review_text: I have traveled extensively over the years, both nationally and internationally, and memorable are the places I have stayed that exude the warmth of home. Welcome to the Bruce House in an upscale historic district in Cumberland, Maryland. It became a favorite the moment I walked through the door. A stately building with a sweeping foyer and an attentive host with a British flair for creating the comforts of home in beautiful and relaxed spaces. With its upholstered seating by a handsome fireplace, the parlor is a great place to convene after hiking or cycling at the nearby GAP trail. The well-equipped kitchenette is a bonus with dishware, utensils, tables and chairs, and a compact fridge, microwave, and sink. Ideal for short or long-term stays. Should you choose The Bruce House for your next lodging experience, I am confident you will be satisfied. It will remain on my radar as one of the best and most affordable experiences in my travels. Thank you, Pam. You ROCK!

review_text: Cozy, comfortable, relaxing, and the place has a lot of character due to its close to 200 year history. Pam was personable and communicated well, including some of the "quirks" that come with an old place like the Bruce House, one of them being, for first floor rooms only, due to the technology of tankless water heaters, the hot water "wake-up call" mechanism does not always kick in. :). If a guest is going to book a first floor room, make sure and ask Pam how to wake up the hot water in the bathroom sink if it appears to be non-responsive to you. I'm a walker, not a driver, and the downtown area is within 10 minutes walk (there is a steep hill for about a block and a half, but I'm used to such hills where I live now - all part of getting some good exercise while I walk!). I'd recommend it to anyone. Oh, and a wide and rich collection of reading materials in the first floor hallway - bookshelves floor to ceiling!

review_text: I would return here in a heartbeat. The host thought of everything that might be needed during the stay, and excellent helps and instructions were on laminated sheets by the bedside. Parking was easy and ideal, even when coming back late at night. Cumberland was showing its best self with beautiful spring flowers and trees everywhere. The lodging shares an intersection with several churches and their parking lots, so there is an open feel to the neighborhood, and some hill/mountain views. I was awestruck by the historical buildings on the nearby streets, as I was by the high ceilings and ornate woodwork in the lodging. My room and bathroom were very clean and the place didn't smell "old", in spite of its age. The coffee service was great, and a bowl of candies was waiting in the foyer. I didn't spend time in the common room, but it was roomy and nicely set up. My room was on the first floor, and there were some nice window shutters that could easily be adjusted for privacy.

I enjoyed a gentle breeze and the pleasant ambience of the historic Cumberland neighborhood, while sipping on a refreshing beer. Our experience with Mark & Becky was epitome Airbnb. Exquisite. The type that makes me want to travel more, meet more strangers, let life happen in new places.
After canceling our original reservation as we found out we could stay with local family, we contacted M&B the afternoon we were due to arrive in Cumberland as my partner had just tested positive for COVID. We were 3000 miles from home, at the beginning of a month-long trip, and needing to pivot majorly and quickly. They welcomed us with compassion and care, accommodating a same-day reservation and checking-in with us (in a thoughtful, kind, and not overbearing way) throughout our stay. Their concern helped me process and more fully experience the moment, and, on the night my partner’s symptoms were really scary, knowing they were up the hill was really reassuring and grounding.
Hopefully your time at Mark & Becky’s won’t be so eventful - and in that case, you’ll be happy to know that theirs is the cleanest (by leaps and bounds) Airbnb I have ever stayed in. They have lovingly and impeccably restored this beautiful old home, so you can have the best of both worlds - modern comforts while honoring and experiencing the history of Queen City. The gardens are magnificent. Take a swing at sunset. Find the church through the trees. Drink coffee with the birds on the porch.
Thank you thank you thank you, Mark and Becky. We are so grateful and so lucky. May the universe cross our paths again someday!!💜
(Unrelated PSA: check out All That 2Go, just down the hill, for delicious and vegetarian-friendly soul food!! Miss Jenny’s banana pudding cake will change your life.)

That was her first of many fond memories from this trip, but not the last time our wonderful hosts would wow us with their overwhelming kindness and generosity.
Trust, every thoughtful accommodation has been made with their guests in mind.
Please don't hesitate to book!

Christine, Shaun and Onnika Lynch
